===Etymology 1===
{{etymon|en|id=pronoun|inh|enm>us>pronoun|tree=1}}
From {{inh|en|enm|us}}, from {{inh|en|ang|Å«s||pos=dative personal pronoun|us}}, from {{inh|en|gem-pro|*uns||us}}, from {{der|en|ine-pro|*ne-}}, {{m|ine-pro|*nÅ-}}, {{m|ine-pro|*n-ge-}}, {{m|ine-pro|*nÌ¥smÃ©||us}}. The compensatory lengthening was lost in Middle English due to the word being unstressed while being used. Cognate with {{cog|stq|uus|t=us}}, {{cog|fy|us}}, {{m|fy|us|Ãºs|us}}, {{cog|nds|us||us}}, {{cog|nl|ons||us}}, {{cog|de|uns||us}}, {{cog|da|os||us}}, {{cog|la|nÅs||we, us}}.

* {{qualifier|unstressed}} {{IPA|en|/É™s/|a=US}}, {{IPA|en|/É™s/|/É™z/|a=UK}}
* {{audio|en|en-us-us.ogg|a=US}}

====Pronoun====
{{en-pron}}

# {{lb|en|personal}} [[me|Me]] and at least one other person; the objective case of '''[[we]]'''.
#* {{RQ:KJV|Luke|1|1|text=Forasmuch as many have taken in hand to set forth in order a declaration of those things which are most surely believed among '''us'''...}}
#: {{non-gloss definition|Used where "me" would be used instead of "I", e.g. for the pronoun in isolation or as the complement of the copula:}}
#:: {{ux|en|Who's there? &mdash;'''Us'''. (or) &mdash;It's '''us'''.}}
#:: {{ux|en|Who's going to go? &mdash;'''Us'''. We'll go.}}
# {{lb|en|Commonwealth|colloquial|chiefly with {{m|en|give}}}} [[me|Me]].
#: {{ux|en|Give '''us''' a look at your paper.}}
#: {{ux|en|Give '''us''' your wallet!}}
#: {{ux|en|She's turned the [[weans]] against '''us'''!}}
# {{lb|en|Northern England}} [[our|Our]].
#: {{ux|en|We'll have to throw '''us''' food out.}}
# {{lb|en|Northumbria}} Me (in all contexts).
#: {{ux|en|Look at '''us''' while youâ€™re speaking to '''us'''.}}
#: {{ux|en|Could you do that for '''us'''?}}
